Narrativa gerada: ConceptMap ConceptMapHRVToOMOP

Mapeamento de (não especificado) para (não especificado)


Grupo 1 Mapeamento de Logical Observation Identifiers, Names and Codes (LOINC) to OHDSI OMOP CDM Concepts (External Reference)

Código fonteRelacionamentoCódigo de destinoComentário
80404-7 (R-R interval.standard deviation (Heart rate variability) [LOINC])is equivalent to37547368 (R-R interval.standard deviation (Heart rate variability))VERIFIED MAPPING via Athena (2025-11-28): - OMOP concept_id: 37547368 - Domain: Measurement - Concept Class: Lab Test - Vocabulary: LOINC - Valid dates: 2020-08-11 to 2099-12-31 - Standard concept: Standard ETL Implementation: - MEASUREMENT.measurement_concept_id = 37547368 - MEASUREMENT.value_as_number = SDNN value - MEASUREMENT.unit_concept_id = 8587 (millisecond) - MEASUREMENT.measurement_type_concept_id = 44818707 (Patient self-reported)
hrv-rmssd-local (RMSSD - Root Mean Square of Successive Differences [Custom])(not mapped)CRITICAL GAP: RMSSD has NO OMOP concept (concept_id = 0) Clinical Importance: - Primary parasympathetic marker (HRV Task Force 1996) - Main HRV metric from consumer wearables (Apple, Oura, Garmin) - Strongly associated with vagal tone and inflammation (RS1 finding) - Mathematical relationship: RMSSD = SD1 × √2 (Poincaré plot) Workaround: 1. Create local custom concept in OMOP vocabulary with concept_class_id = 'Observable Entity' 2. Map to general HRV concept 37547368 with qualifier (data loss) 3. Store in measurement_source_value field (non-standardized) Recommendation: Submit new concept proposal to OHDSI Vocabulary team
hrv-pnn50-local (pNN50 - Percentage of NN intervals >50ms [Custom])(not mapped)GAP: pNN50 has no OMOP concept (concept_id = 0) Clinical notes: - High correlation with RMSSD (r > 0.90) - Parasympathetic marker - Unit: percentage (%) - Normal range: typically 20-30% in healthy adults ETL workaround: Store as measurement_source_value = 'pNN50:{value}%'
hrv-lf-hf-local (LF/HF Ratio - Low to High Frequency Power Ratio [Custom])(not mapped)GAP: LF/HF ratio has no OMOP concept (concept_id = 0) Clinical notes: - Autonomic balance indicator (sympathovagal) - Interpretation is debated in literature - Dimensionless ratio - Typically 1.5-2.0 in healthy adults at rest ETL workaround: Store in measurement_source_value with qualifier
8867-4 (Heart rate [LOINC])is equivalent to3027018 (Heart rate)Verified standard OMOP concept for heart rate. - OMOP concept_id: 3027018 - Unit_concept_id: 8541 (per minute, {beats}/min) - Critical contextual data for HRV interpretation
40443-4 (Heart rate --resting [LOINC])maps to wider concept3027018 (Heart rate)Maps to general heart rate concept. Resting context can be captured in: - visit_occurrence.visit_concept_id - measurement qualifier - observation_period context Resting HR is critical for HRV baseline interpretation (Uth formula: VO2max = HRmax/HRrest × 15)

Grupo 2 Mapeamento de SNOMED CT (all versions) to OHDSI OMOP CDM Concepts (External Reference)

Código fonteRelacionamentoCódigo de destinoComentário
86290005 (Respiratory rate [SNOMED])is equivalent to3024171 (Respiratory rate)Critical for HRV interpretation. RSA (respiratory sinus arrhythmia) affects HF power band.

name: ConceptMapHRVToOMOP
title: HRV LOINC to OMOP CDM Mapping
description:
Maps HRV (Heart Rate Variability) metrics from LOINC codes to OMOP CDM concepts for federated analytics.

Key Findings from RS4 Systematic Review (354 papers analyzed):
- ZERO documented HRV-OMOP transformations in peer-reviewed literature
- Only ONE OMOP concept available: 37547368 (SDNN via LOINC 80404-7)
- CRITICAL GAP: RMSSD, pNN50, LF/HF have NO OMOP concepts (concept_id = 0)

This ConceptMap enables:
- SpringBatch ETL pipelines (Peng et al. achieved 99% DQD compliance)
- Incremental loading patterns (Henke et al. achieved 87.5% time reduction)
- OHDSI network study participation for wearable HRV data

Target OMOP Table: MEASUREMENT
- measurement_concept_id: mapped OMOP concept
- value_as_number: HRV metric value
- unit_concept_id: 8587 (millisecond) for time-domain metrics
- measurement_type_concept_id: 44818707 (Patient self-reported/device)
purpose: Enable ETL transformation of wearable HRV data from FHIR (LOINC-coded) to OMOP CDM for research analytics in OHDSI federated network.

target.comment:
VERIFIED MAPPING via Athena (2025-11-28):
- OMOP concept_id: 37547368
- Domain: Measurement
- Concept Class: Lab Test
- Vocabulary: LOINC
- Valid dates: 2020-08-11 to 2099-12-31
- Standard concept: Standard

ETL Implementation:
- MEASUREMENT.measurement_concept_id = 37547368
- MEASUREMENT.value_as_number = SDNN value
- MEASUREMENT.unit_concept_id = 8587 (millisecond)
- MEASUREMENT.measurement_type_concept_id = 44818707 (Patient self-reported)

element.display: RMSSD - Root Mean Square of Successive Differences [Custom]

target.comment:
CRITICAL GAP: RMSSD has NO OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)

Clinical Importance:
- Primary parasympathetic marker (HRV Task Force 1996)
- Main HRV metric from consumer wearables (Apple, Oura, Garmin)
- Strongly associated with vagal tone and inflammation (RS1 finding)
- Mathematical relationship: RMSSD = SD1 × √2 (Poincaré plot)

Workaround:
1. Create local custom concept in OMOP vocabulary with concept_class_id = 'Observable Entity'
2. Map to general HRV concept 37547368 with qualifier (data loss)
3. Store in measurement_source_value field (non-standardized)

Recommendation: Submit new concept proposal to OHDSI Vocabulary team

GAP: pNN50 has no OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)

Clinical notes:
- High correlation with RMSSD (r > 0.90)
- Parasympathetic marker
- Unit: percentage (%)
- Normal range: typically 20-30% in healthy adults

ETL workaround: Store as measurement_source_value = 'pNN50:{value}%'

element.display: LF/HF Ratio - Low to High Frequency Power Ratio [Custom]

target.comment:
GAP: LF/HF ratio has no OMOP concept (concept_id = 0)

Clinical notes:
- Autonomic balance indicator (sympathovagal)
- Interpretation is debated in literature
- Dimensionless ratio
- Typically 1.5-2.0 in healthy adults at rest

ETL workaround: Store in measurement_source_value with qualifier

Verified standard OMOP concept for heart rate.
- OMOP concept_id: 3027018
- Unit_concept_id: 8541 (per minute, {beats}/min)
- Critical contextual data for HRV interpretation

Maps to general heart rate concept.
Resting context can be captured in:
- visit_occurrence.visit_concept_id
- measurement qualifier
- observation_period context

Resting HR is critical for HRV baseline interpretation (Uth formula: VO2max = HRmax/HRrest × 15)

unmapped.display: No OMOP concept - requires custom vocabulary extension

target.comment: Critical for HRV interpretation. RSA (respiratory sinus arrhythmia) affects HF power band.
